front.title: Obtaining Relay Addresses from Simple Traversal Underneath NAT (STUN)

abstract.t: This specification defines a usage of the Simple Traversal Underneath NAT (STUN) Protocol for asking the STUN server to relay packets towards a client. This usage is useful for elements behind NATs whose mapping behavior is address and port dependent. The extension purposefully restricts the ways in which the relayed address can be used. In particular, it prevents users from running general purpose servers from ports obtained from the STUN server.
